parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A fountain, spring, well, issue, flow. Probably from pegnumi; a fount, i.e. Source or supply.
Without water, dry; subst: dry places, desert. Waterless, i.e. Dry.
A mist, dimness, darkening. Of uncertain derivation; dimness of sight, i.e. a cataract.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: (a) trans: I drive (on), propel, (b) intrans: I row. A prolonged form of a primary verb of uncertain affinity; to push.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
A sudden storm, squall, whirlwind, hurricane. Of uncertain derivation; a whirlwind.
Darkness, murkiness, gloom. Akin to the base of nephos; gloom.
Darkness, either physical or moral. From the base of skia; shadiness, i.e. Obscurity.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
